1.name: It's a Wonderful Life
1.description: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

2.name: The Harvey Girls
2.description: On a train trip West to become a mail-order bride, Susan Bradley (Judy Garland) meets a cheery crew of young women travelling out to open a "Harvey House" restaurant at a remote whistle-stop.

3.name: The Strange Love of Martha Ivers
3.description: A man is reunited with his childhood friend and her husband, who believe he knows the truth about the death of her rich aunt years earlier.

4.name: Night and Day
4.description: A fictionalized biopic of composer Cole Porter from his days at Yale in the 1910s through the height of his success to the 1940s.

5.name: The Stranger
5.description: An investigator from the War Crimes Commission travels to Connecticut to find an infamous Nazi.

6.name: The Best Years of Our Lives
6.description: Three World War II veterans return home to small-town America to discover that they and their families have been irreparably changed.

7.name: The Big Sleep
7.description: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a rich family. Before the complex case is over, he's seen murder, blackmail, and what might be love.

8.name: Notorious
8.description: A woman is asked to spy on a group of Nazi friends in South America. How far will she have to go to ingratiate herself with them?

9.name: Song of the South
9.description: The kindly story-teller Uncle Remus tells a young boy stories about trickster Br'er Rabbit, who outwits Br'er Fox and slow-witted Br'er Bear.

10.name: Dragonwyck
10.description: A simple Connecticut farm girl is recruited by a distant relative, an aristocratic patroon, to be governess to his young daughter in his Hudson Valley mansion.

11.name: Gilda
11.description: A small-time gambler hired to work in a Buenos Aires casino discovers his employer's new wife is his former lover.

12.name: The Killers
12.description: Hit men kill an unresisting victim, and investigator Reardon uncovers his past involvement with beautiful, deadly Kitty Collins.

13.name: My Darling Clementine
13.description: The Earps battle the Clantons at the OK Corral in Tombstone, Arizona.

14.name: Great Expectations
14.description: A humble orphan suddenly becomes a gentleman with the help of an unknown benefactor.

15.name: A Matter of Life and Death
15.description: A British wartime aviator who cheats death must argue for his life before a celestial court.

16.name: Duel in the Sun
16.description: Beautiful half-breed Pearl Chavez becomes the ward of her dead father's first love and finds herself torn between her sons, one good and the other bad.

17.name: The Overlanders
17.description: It's the start of WWII in Northern Australia. The Japanese are getting close. People are evacuating and burning everything in a "scorched earth" policy. Rather than kill all their cattle, a...                See full summary »

18.name: The Postman Always Rings Twice
18.description: A married woman and a drifter fall in love, then plot to murder her husband.

19.name: La belle et la bête
19.description: A beautiful young woman takes her father's place as the prisoner of a mysterious beast, who wishes to marry her.

20.name: Cluny Brown
20.description: A free-spirited parlor maid and a Czech refugee surprise an English village with their unconventional ways.

21.name: Black Angel
21.description: When Kirk Bennett is convicted of a singer's murder, his wife tries to prove him innocent...aided by the victim's ex-husband.

22.name: The Razor's Edge
22.description: An adventuresome young man goes off to find himself and loses his socialite fiancée in the process. But when he returns 10 years later, she will stop at nothing to get him back, even though she is already married.

23.name: Green for Danger
23.description: After the nurse who declares that a recent surgical death was a murder dies also, an enigmatic Scotland Yard inspector arrives to investigate.

24.name: The Yearling
24.description: A boy persuades his parents to allow him to adopt a young deer, but what will happen if the deer misbehaves?

25.name: The Spiral Staircase
25.description: In 1916, a shadowy serial killer is targeting women with "afflictions"; one night during a thunderstorm, the mute Helen feels menaced.

26.name: Cloak and Dagger
26.description: In WW2, the Allies race against time to persuade two nuclear scientists working for the Germans to switch sides.

27.name: The Blue Dahlia
27.description: An ex-bomber pilot is suspected of murdering his unfaithful wife.

28.name: The Chase
28.description: Chuck Scott gets a job as chauffeur to tough guy Eddie Roman; but Chuck's involvement with Eddie's fearful wife becomes a nightmare.

29.name: Paisà
29.description: The language barrier has tragic consequences in a series of unrelated stories set during the Italian Campaign of WWII.

30.name: Sciuscià
30.description: Two shoeshine boys in postwar Rome, Italy, save up to buy a horse, but their involvement as dupes in a burglary lands them in juvenile prison where the experience take a devastating toll on their friendship.

31.name: Till the Clouds Roll By
31.description: Biography of songwriter and Broadway pioneer, Jerome Kern (Robert Walker). Unable to find immediate success in the U.S., Kern sought recognition abroad. He journeyed to England where his dreams of success became real and where he met his future wife Eva Leale (Dorothy Patrick).

32.name: The Strange Woman
32.description: In 1820s New England beautiful but poor and manipulative Jenny Hager marries rich old man Isaiah Poster but also seduces his son and his company foreman.

33.name: Dressed to Kill
33.description: Sherlock Holmes sets out to discover why a trio of murderous villains, including a dangerously attractive female, are desperate to obtain three unassuming and inexpensive little music boxes.

34.name: My Reputation
34.description: A recent widow meets an army major while skiing and despite pressures from friends and family becomes romantically involved with him.

35.name: The Time of Their Lives
35.description: Two ghosts who were mistakenly branded as traitors during the Revolutionary War return to 20th century New England to retrieve a letter from George Washington which would prove their ...                See full summary »

36.name: Piccadilly Incident
36.description: Anna Neagle is a World War II W.R.E.N., the counterpart of the American W.A.V.E., who encounters Michael Wilding in a blacked-out Piccadilly during an air raid. They get married and have a ...                See full summary »

37.name: Without Reservations
37.description: En route to Hollywood, an author becomes smitten with a marine, though he is unaware of her celebrity status and is critical of her best-selling novel.

38.name: Somewhere in the Night
38.description: George Taylor returns from WWII with amnesia. Back home in Los Angeles, while trying to track down his old identity, he stumbles onto a 3-year old murder case and a hunt for a missing $2 million.

39.name: Make Mine Music
39.description: Animation done to contemporary popular music.

40.name: Lady in the Lake
40.description: The lady editor of a crime magazine hires Philip Marlowe to find the wife of her boss. The private detective soon finds himself involved in murder.

41.name: Canyon Passage
41.description: Businessman Logan Stuart is torn between his love of two very different women in 1850's Oregon and his loyalty to a compulsive gambler friend who goes over the line.

42.name: Terror by Night
42.description: When the fabled Star of Rhodesia diamond is stolen on a London to Edinburgh train and the son of its owner is murdered, Sherlock Holmes must discover which of his suspicious fellow passengers is responsible.

43.name: The Virginian
43.description: In Medicine Bow, a newly arrived eastern schoolteacher is courted by two cowpokes but their courtship is interrupted by violent incidents involving local cattle rustlers.

44.name: The Diary of a Chambermaid
44.description: Célestine (Paulette Goddard), the chambermaid, has a new job in the country, at the Lanlaires. She has decided to use her beauty to seduce a wealthy man, but Mr. Lanlaire (Reginald Owen) is...                See full summary »

45.name: The Madonna's Secret
45.description: The sister of a murdered model poses for the same artist to try to catch her killer.

46.name: Panique
46.description: After an elderly maid is murdered, opinions are manipulated, evidence is planted, violence erupts, and panic ensues.

47.name: To Each His Own
47.description: An unwed mother, forced to give up her child to avoid scandal, follows her son's life from afar even as she prospers in business.

48.name: The Dark Corner
48.description: A secretary tries to help her boss, who is framed for a murder.

49.name: The Dark Mirror
49.description: A man is found murdered, with witnesses convinced about the woman they saw leaving his apartment. However, it becomes apparent that the woman has a twin, and finding out which one is the killer seems impossible.

50.name: The Verdict
50.description: After an innocent man is executed in a case he was responsible for, a Scotland Yard superintendent finds himself investigating the murder of his key witness.
